channel.title: StereoMix Pack - Updated with new versions 1
channel.description: Hey guys :) I have made a couple of stereo mixers I thought I wanted to share. There is 1ch, 2ch, 3ch, 4ch and 4ch with chain. The chain function on the 4ch mixer can be used to link more mixers together without using the regular inputs. One of those "nice to have things" that is boring making over and over again. Here you go: StMix1.axs (2.4 KB) StMix2.axs (5.0 KB) StMix2M.axs (6.1 KB) StMix3.axs (6.7 KB) StMix3M.axs (7.7 KB) StMix4.axs (8.4 KB) StMix4M.axs (9.4 KB) StMix4Ch.axs (9.0 KB) StMix4ChM.axs (10.0 KB) StMix4ChMOut.axs (9.8 KB) EDIT: I have updated the StereoMix Pack with versions with Master Out knobs. Don't know why I didnt add this in the first place. Anyway now they are added with an M in the end of the name. There is also a version of the 4ch mixer which has build in Audio output. This one takes a lot less space than the others, cause there are no labels for the outputs. Enjoy :)

item.title: StereoMix Pack - Updated with new versions 1
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

@AdrianWillaert

I was just playing around with the mixer again and now I realized it is the crossfader that does it. I am not sure it is intended to use it like this. I think I'll need to update them again, Maybe with vca or math/* instead.. Then it will probably work as supposed

EDIT: Ok so now I just made tried to maake an example for the developer and now it sounds fine. I guess sometimes it has to load up a few times before it works 100%.

Read full topic

item.title: StereoMix Pack - Updated with new versions 1
item.dc:creator: @AdrianWillaert
item.description:
@AdrianWillaert wrote:

Definitely love and use in large amount your pack but I've noticed that the sound is slightly unbalanced on the left when using a stereo mix. Can't figure out why because looking at the patches everything seems ok but the difference is pretty undeniable

Read full topic
item.source: StereoMix Pack - Updated with new versions 1

item.title: StereoMix Pack - Updated with new versions 1
item.dc:creator: @anon5189335
item.description:
@anon5189335 wrote:

Hey guys

I have made a couple of stereo mixers I thought I wanted to share. There is 1ch, 2ch, 3ch, 4ch and 4ch with chain. The chain function on the 4ch mixer can be used to link more mixers together without using the regular inputs. One of those "nice to have things" that is boring making over and over again. Here you go:

New mixers added.png1275x774 124 KB

StMix1.axs (2.4 KB)

StMix2.axs (5.0 KB)

StMix2M.axs (6.1 KB)

StMix3.axs (6.7 KB)

StMix3M.axs (7.7 KB)

StMix4.axs (8.4 KB)

StMix4M.axs (9.4 KB)

StMix4Ch.axs (9.0 KB)

StMix4ChM.axs (10.0 KB)

StMix4ChMOut.axs (9.8 KB)

EDIT: I have updated the StereoMix Pack with versions with Master Out knobs. Don't know why I didnt add this in the first place. Anyway now they are added with an M in the end of the name. There is also a version of the 4ch mixer which has build in Audio output. This one takes a lot less space than the others, cause there are no labels for the outputs. Enjoy

Read full topic
